N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.37 - Executive order no. 37: establishing the governor's task force on adolescent pregnancy

State Regulations
WHEREAS, adolescent pregnancy is an increasingly pervasive
and complex social problem affecting adolescents from diverse
backgrounds; WHEREAS, approximately one out of every 10 adolescent
females becomes pregnant each year; WHEREAS, high rates of adolescent pregnancy have resulted
in long-term dependence on the public welfare system and increased high school
drop-out rates; and
WHEREAS, the success in serving adolescents at high risk of
pregnancy, pregnant adolescents and adolescent parents depends in large part
upon the ability of State agencies to coordinate their efforts in partnership
with the private and voluntary sectors and local governmental agencies toward
creating new avenues to dignity for young New Yorkers; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and laws
of the State of New York, do hereby establish, within the Executive Department, the Governor's Task Force on Adolescent Pregnancy. I. Membership. The Task Force shall consist of the Honorary Chair and the

Executive Director of the Council on Children and Families; the Commissioners
of the Department of Social Services, Department of Health, Education

Department and Department of Labor; the Directors of the Division for Youth, the Women's Division and the Division of the Budget; and such additional
members as shall be appointed by the Governor who have demonstrated expertise
in adolescent pregnancy prevention services or who are interested in the
provision of such services to pregnant adolescents and adolescent parents. The
members of the Task Force shall receive no compensation for their services, but
shall be entitled to reimbursement for any necessary expenses incurred in
connection with the performance of their duties. II. General Charge and Duties. The Governor's Task Force shall: 1. analyze the availability and accessibility
of services to adolescents at high risk of pregnancy, pregnant adolescents and
adolescent parents in order to make recommendations for improving the delivery
and coordination of such services; 2. promote the development and implementation
of family life education programs or other preventive strategies, with special
emphasis on high risk adolescents and their families; 3. insure the cost-effective expenditure of
funds for services through the review of agency funding mechanisms and through
the establishment of guidelines for disbursement of funds to local
providers; 4. encourage, at the
local and regional levels, the provision of technical assistance for improving
the coordination of services to adolescents at high risk of pregnancy, pregnant
adolescents and adolescent parents; 5. enhance the independence and
self-sufficiency of pregnant teen-agers and teenage mothers by recommending
services to permit adolescents to continue their education, have access to day
care and receive adequate vocational and employment training; and
6. submit a report to the Governor and

Legislature by January 31, 1985, and annually thereafter, documenting the
progress of the Task Force and containing recommendations for the delivery, funding and coordination of services. III. Assistance to the Task Force. All departments, divisions, boards, offices and public
corporations of the State are directed to cooperate with the Task Force and to
provide such assistance as the Task Force may require to fulfill its purposes. Such assistance may include, but need not be limited to, the use of agency
staff, the provision of statistical and policy data in such form as is
determined by the Task Force and consultation with agency staff as the Task

Force shall require. In addition, all departments, divisions, boards, offices
and public corporations of the State are directed to identify immediately any
barriers to meeting the needs of pregnant adolescents, adolescent parents and
those at high risk of pregnancy and to target available resources to maximize
the impact of initiatives directed at this population. To the extent that funds are from time to time provided to
the Task Force, subject to the approval of the Director of the Budget, the

Executive Director of the Council may employ such personnel as he or she deems
necessary and desirable to carry out the charge and duties of the Task Force
and provide them with compensation within the amounts available
therefor. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: April 5, 1984
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
